This privacy policy ("Policy") describes how we collect, protect and use the personally identifiable information ("Personal Information") you ("User", "you" or "your") provided on the
We also collect information from the URLs from which you linked to our Site.
What Information We Collect
When users come to our Site, we may track, collect and aggregate information indicating, among other things, which pages of our Site were visited, the order in which they were visited, when they were visited, and which hyperlinks were "clicked."

In addition, we reserve the right to transfer Personal Information in the event we sell or transfer all or a portion of our business or assets (including in the event of a reorganization, dissolution or liquidation).
We also use (or may use) cookies and web beacons when you visit our Site.
Please note that our service provider - not iDecisionGames - collects and processes your credit card information.

When you email us with a request, we may ask that you provide us with information necessary to confirm your identity.
When you send us an email message or otherwise contact us, we may use the information provided by you to respond to your communication and/or as described in this Privacy Policy.

text: Please note that we rely on legitimate interests as the basis for processing your data in the limited circumstances set out below: We will use information relating to your use of our services for statistical analysis and research purposes, however we delete your name and email address from such information before we do so.

We use information relating to your use of the Site to build higher quality, more useful services by performing statistical analyses of the collective characteristics and behavior of our users, and by measuring demographics and interests regarding specific areas of our Site.
What Information We Collect

1. Information relating to your use of our Site.

We process your personal data as set out in this Privacy Policy on the basis of your consent.
We use your personal information for the purposes set out in the "How We Use the Information" section of this Privacy Policy below, including providing our site and services to you, ensuring the security and performance of our site, research relating to academic courses, sharing information with our partners (such as academic institutions) and our suppliers, direct marketing and performing statistical analysis of the use of our site and services.
We will only transfer Personal Information to third parties where the third party: (i) has provided satisfactory assurances to us that it will protect the Personal Information in accordance with this Privacy Shield Policy and the Principles; (ii) is located in the EU or a country considered "adequate" for privacy by the EU Commission, and therefore is required to comply with the EU data protection laws or substantially equivalent privacy laws; or (iii) has certified to Privacy Shield, and is independently responsible for complying with the Principles.
We will process Personal Information in a manner that is compatible with and relevant to the purpose for which it was collected or authorized by you.
We may also use or publish posts submitted on the Forums without using Personally Identification Information.

data_type: reasonable access to personal information about you we hold
text: Upon request, we will provide you with reasonable access to the Personal Information about you that we hold.

Please note that we rely on legitimate interests as the basis for processing your data in the limited circumstances set out below: We will retain your student records relating to degrees or credit-bearing courses for our own compliance and verification purposes (including where we are required to do so by our academic institution partners), even after you withdraw your consent to our processing of your data;
